body_html:
@RohitDulam It's currently not possible to build Android TF on Windows directly using Bazel (this is a Bazel limitation). See #6385 for details and workarounds. The preferred method of using TF on Android is the AAR distribution which allows integration with a few lines of configuration. You can also manually download the prebuilt binaries as others suggest.

@jubjamie Agreed that a more comprehensive official walkthrough would be useful, this is something we plan on adding.

@RohitDulam It's currently not possible to build Android TF on Windows directly using Bazel (this is a Bazel limitation). See #6385 for details and workarounds. The preferred method of using TF on Android is the AAR distribution which allows integration with a few lines of configuration. You can also manually download the prebuilt binaries as others suggest.
@jubjamie Agreed that a more comprehensive official walkthrough would be useful, this is something we plan on adding.
body:
@RohitDulam It's currently not possible to build Android TF on Windows directly using Bazel (this is a Bazel limitation). See https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/6385 for details and workarounds. The preferred method of using TF on Android is the [AAR distribution](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/6385#issuecomment-299913647) which allows integration with a few lines of configuration. You can also manually download the prebuilt binaries as others suggest.

@jubjamie Agreed that a more comprehensive official walkthrough would be useful, this is something we plan on adding.
